children.name: overhear c2
children.definition: overhear to accidentally hear what sb is saying, when they do not realize that you can hear them: tình cờ nge được, nghe lỏm được
examples: ▪ claire, who was outside the door, overheard their conversation.
overhear sb saying/talking etc
▪ we overheard jenny and her friends talking about their boyfriends last night.
i couldn’t help overhearingsay this when you have accidentally overheard sb saying sth
▪ i couldn’t help overhearing you and jim last night - is something wrong?

children.name: hear a1
children.partOfSpeech: [i or t verb not in progressive]
children.definition: hear nghe
examples: ▪ did you hear that noise?
▪ suddenly we heard a knock at the door.
▪ say that again -- i didn’t hear you.
▪ she called after him but he kept on walking and pretended not to hear.
hear sb/sth doing sth
▪ neighbours heard the child screaming and called the police.
▪ i could have sworn i heard the phone ringing.
hear sb/sth do sth nghe
▪ i heard the front door close, and knew that bob had left for work.
▪ did you hear them announce the result?

children.name: to listen to sb or sth
listen a1
children.definition: listen to pay attention to what sb is saying or to a sound that you hear: lắng nghe
examples: ▪ i didn’t hear the answer, because i wasn’t listening when she read it out.
▪ if you listened in class you might get better grades.
listen to
▪ he listened carefully to every word i said.
▪ i could listen to placido domingo all day -- he has such a beautiful voice!
listen hardtry hard to hear something that is very quiet cố gắng lắng nghe
▪ if you listen hard, you can hear the sound of the sea in the distance.
listen carefully
▪ the company has begun to listen more carefully to its customers, in a determined attempt to improve customer service.
listen intentlylisten very carefully to hear what sb is saying
▪ mrs singh leaned forward, listening intently as they explained the procedure to her.

children.name: pay attention b1
children.definition: pay attention to listen carefully to what sb is saying:để ý kĩ ,chăm chú nghe
examples: ▪ i have some important information about travel arrangements, so please pay attention.
▪ billy’s a smart kid, but he doesn’t pay attention in class.
pay attention to
▪ she went on talking, but i wasn’t really paying attention to what she was saying.
▪ according to the survey, two-thirds of young people do not follow politics and pay no attention to election campaigns.

children.name: listen for x
children.definition: listen for/ listen out for sth to listen carefully for a sound that you are expecting to hear, although you do not know when it will happen:chú ý lắng nghe
examples: ▪ we hid behind the door, listening for the sound of the guard’s footsteps.
▪ the flight had been delayed, and so i waited in the departure lounge listening for announcements.
▪ she lay in bed, listening out for the sound of his feet on the stairs.

children.name: hear sb out x
children.definition: hear sb out to listen to all of what sb wants to tell you without interrupting them, especially when you disagree with them or do not believe them:cố nghe hết
examples: ▪ hear me out first, jane, and then you can say what you think.
▪ knapp heard him out patiently but still refused to change his mind.

children.name: when you can not hear sb or sth
didn't hear a1
children.definition: didn’t hear use this when you did not hear something at all, especially when you did not realize there was anything to hear: chưa nghe thấy
examples: i was outside in the yard, so i didn’t hear the phone.
she was staring out of the window and didn’t hear the teacher.
didn’t hear sb do sth
what time did you get back last night? i didn’t hear you come in.
didn’t hear sb/sth doing sth
she didn’t hear the car pulling up outside the house.

children.name: inaudible x
children.definition: inaudible not loud enough to be heard:không nghe được
examples: nick’s voice was inaudible through the glass barrier.
three girls were singing something but their words were almost inaudible.

children.name: can't hear a1
children.definition: can’t hear không nghe thấy
examples: speak up a bit. i can’t hear you.
could you turn the radio up - i can’t hear the news.
let’s move nearer to the front. i can’t hear very well here.
the music was so loud that i couldn’t hear what she was saying.

children.name: didn't catch x
children.definition: didn’t catch say this when you did not hear what sbsaid, because they were speaking too quietly or because you were not listening carefully:
examples: ‘what did he just say?’ ‘i didn’t quite catch it.’
i’m sorry, i didn’t catch your name.
he turned away from me so i didn’t catch what he said.

children.name: can’t make sth out b2
children.definition: can’t make sth out to not be able to hear what sb is saying because it is very quiet or unclear:không hiểu rõ
examples: mat whispered something but i couldn’t make out the words.
she knew they were arguing though she couldn’t make out exactly what they were saying,

children.name: out of earshot x
children.definition: out of earshot if you are out of earshot you are not near enough to sb or sth to be able to hear them :ngoài tầm nghe
examples: as soon as the guards were out of earshot, grimes explained his plans.
out of earshot of
the social worker wanted to talk to the children out of earshot of their parents.

children.name: eavesdrop x
children.definition: eavesdrop tosecretlylisten to sb else’s conversation by standing near them, hiding behind a door etc:nghe trộm
examples: how did you know i was going? you’ve been eavesdropping, haven’t you!
eavesdrop on sb/sth
i caught him eavesdropping on our conversation.
sue was able to eavesdrop on them through the open window.
he was eavesdroppingonour conversation.

children.name: listen in c2
children.definition: listen in to listen to sb else’s conversation when they do not know that you are listening, either on the telephone or when you are near them:nghe lén
examples: whenever her boss had one of his ‘private meetings’, she always used to listen in.
listen in on sth
we tried to listen in on their conversation, but they were talking too quietly
they used to have hours of fun listening in on what people were doing in their hotel rooms.
i wish dad would stop listening in on my phone conversations.

children.name: bug x
children.definition: bug to hide a small piece of electronic recording equipment in someone’s room, car, office etc in order to listen secretly to what is said there: đặt máy ghi âm nghe trộm
examples: security agents bugged their offices and managed to get some evidence against them.
wells was convinced the house was bugged and insisted on playing loud music while we talked.

children.name: tap x
children.definition: tap to connect a piece of electronic recording equipment to a telephone system so that you can listen to people’s telephone conversations: mắc rẽ vào điện thoại nghe trộm
examples: later we realized our phones had been tapped and the police knew everything.
the president had to resign over an illegal phone-tapping operation.
he suspected that histelephonehad been tapped.

children.name: monitor c1
children.definition: monitor to listen to another country’s radio or television broadcasts or radio messages in order to get information about that country:giám sát
examples: satellite technology means that enemy airwaves can be monitored more closely than ever before.

children.name: when you can hear sb or sth
audible x
children.definition: audible loud enough to be heard:nghe thấy được
examples: the signal is clearly audible up to 200 miles away.
when the engine finally started she gave an audible sigh of relief.
barely audiblealmost not audible dường như không nghe thấy được
his voice was barely audible above the noise of the generator.

children.name: filter c2
children.definition: filter if sound filters into a place, it can be heard only slightly :
examples: the familiar notes of beethoven’s ‘für elise’ filtered from the bar.

children.name: can hear a1
children.definition: can hear có thể nghe thấy
examples: you don’t have to shout, i can hear you!
the explosion could be heard over 10 miles away.
can you hear all right or do you want me to turn the television up?
can hear sb/sth doing something
we knew he was asleep because we could hear him snoring.
can hear what sb says
could you hear what she was saying?

children.name: can make out b2
children.definition: can make out if you can make out what sb is saying, you can hear them but it is difficult: nghe được (mặc dù không dễ nghe)
examples: she was crying and the only thing i could make out was lou’s name.
sarah spoke so softly that kathryn could hardly make out her words.
now and then i could just make out george’s voice above the music.
i could make out the sound of thunder in the distance.

children.name: within earshot x
children.definition: within earshot if you are within earshot, you are near enough to sb to be able to hear what they are saying: trong tầm nghe
examples: you can play anywhere on the beach as long as you stay within earshot.
within earshot of
two of the shop assistants were complaining loudly within earshot of the customers.

children.name: carry u
children.definition: carry if a sound carries, it can be heard a long distance away from where the sound was made:vang xa
examples: deeper sounds carry further than high-pitched ones.
carry across/ down/ through etc sth
their voices carried across the lake to where we were sitting.

children.name: what you say when telling sb to listen
listen a1
children.definition: listensay this when you want sb to listen and pay attention to what you are saying: nghe
examples: listen! there’s someone coming upstairs!
listen, i’ve just had a really good idea.

children.name: listen up x
children.definition: listen up say this when you want sb, especially a group of people, to pay close attention to what you are saying, especially when you are giving them instructions:
examples: okay, class. listen up. open your books at page 33.
the directions are complicated so listen up.
okay everyone - listen up! i have an announcement to make.

children.name: listen to a1
children.definition: listen to to listen to a radio programme or a particular radio station: lắng nghe
examples: lucy sat in her car, listening to the radio.
i always listen to the news while i have my breakfast.
what station are you listening to?

children.name: tune in x
children.definition: tune in to turn on your radio and listen to a particular programme, especially if you do this at the same time each week: theo dõi
examples: be sure to tune in next week at the same time for another exciting episode of ‘death ray’.
tune in to
tune in to the breakfast show tomorrow to win vip tickets to the lollapalooza festival on long island.

children.name: to make sth impossible to hearh
drown out c2
children.definition: drown out if sth drowns sth or sb out, it is so loud or noisy that you cannot hear them properly:làm át đi
examples: his voice was drowned out by the traffic.
drown out sth/ drown sth out
the applause from the audience almost drowned out the music.
some of the crowd were now hissing and stamping their feet in an attempt to drown him out.

children.name: mishear x
children.definition: mishear to fail to hear sb's words correctly or in the way that was intended and to think that something different was said: nghe lầm
examples: i'm sure i never said that! you must have misheard (me).
it seemed a strange question; i wondered if i had misheard.
you must have misheard him.
